The Pregnancy Center, Kailua Kona Hawaii

Absolutely!
 
 And what level of intensive medical care do these survivors need? Possibly for the rest of their lives? Of course, even though I am a taxpayer, I don't have that much of a problem with my tax dollar supporting the lives of these little mites, but too often I find that all the worshipers of fetuses are loath to publicly care for such individuals. Right to life -- and a right to a decent life -- seems to end when an individual leaves the womb for these fetus worshipers.

Absolutely!

Of course, even though I am a taxpayer, I don't have that much of a problem with my tax dollar supporting the lives of these little mites, but too often I find that all the worshipers of fetuses are loath to publicly care for such individuals.  What in the world are you talking about? Did you even click on the link? Here is what it say's below a picture of three beautiful, perfectly formed babies growing within their mothers womb.
 This is an acutal 4D picture of triplets inside the womb - how absolutely precious and human. At 18 weeks your baby is a marvel to see and to feel. Your baby has the ability to make sounds, turn around inside of you, kick and grasp with its hands.
 Here's the picture: http://app.razorplanet.com/acct/41260-2470/images/18_Weeks_2.jpg
 
 How sad, bitter and cynical you are simone to refer to these babies as mites and charge people who love the unborn enough to speak in their defense with being fetus worshipers as you scream in favor of the women who demand the right to kill their own unborn babies.

All I asked is how much intensive medical care these precious little mites are going to need. Do you have a problem with reality, Archie?
 
 Also, are you willing to foot the bill with your tax dollar for all the ongoing medical care these children are going to require throughout their lives. I don't have a problem with that. 
 
 Do you, Archie?

All I asked is how much intensive medical care these precious little mites are going to need. Do you have a problem with reality, Archie?
 
 Also, are you willing to foot the bill with your tax dollar for all the ongoing medical care these children are going to require throughout their lives. I don't have a problem with that. 
 
 Do you, Archie?

 
 How ignorant and presumptuous are you to suggest that just because they are triplets, they will require any extra medical care at all? This article makes no such suggestion at all. You are purposely looking to attribute negative connotations to their existence which is a blatantly fallacious inference. Do those 18 week old babies look sickly to you? http://app.razorplanet.com/acct/41260-2470/images/18_Weeks_2.jpg Or like they're in need of special care?
 
 And yes, simone, I would be, and have been willing to personally help procure medical care for children in need of specialized care. And I'm not speaking about my tax dollars, but personally paying bills when parents were overwhelmed by the expenses for needed operations or procedures. Why do you automatically assume we pro-lifers are all talk and no action, just because you pro-death advocates are!

Multiple births almost always present medical problems. They are often premature, underweight and demand intensive care.
 
 Triplets birthed after only 18 weeks in utero, approximately half of a normal pregnancy term, must assuredly demand a great deal of intensive care.
 
 Thanks for assuring me that at least a few anti-choicers are willing to put their money where their mouths are.
